body:
Comment 5: 
Sure, here's a situation:

Often an HTTP-based API will listen for a GET/POST and respond with a JSON object in the
body of a HTTP response. On the browser side, people use e.g. jQuery AJAX, which
automatically reads the JSON response and converts it to JavaScript struct without
interfering
with the case.
And so the awkward thing is you start with a Go struct like
type S struct { int A }
and you end up with a JavaScript struct
type S struct { int a }.
